thread.title: Saudi king Salman bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud to take 459 tons of luggage on trip to Indonesia
thread.title_full: Saudi king Salman bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud to take 459 tons of luggage on trip to Indonesia

author: Adam Taylor
title: Saudi king Salman bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud to take 459 tons of luggage on trip to Indonesia
text:
Saudi king Salman bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud to take 459 tons of luggage on trip to Indonesia ADAM TAYLOR Last updated 10:44, February 28 2017 REUTERS 
King Salman bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud is known for his lavish travel, having once booked out an entire Four Seasons hotel. 
Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud is heading to Indonesia this week for a nine-day visit. It will be the first time in 46 years that a Saudi king has visited the world's largest Muslim nation, and it comes at a time of heightened attention on the economic links between the two nations. 
But Salman has come prepared. According to reports in the Indonesian press, the Saudi royal is expected to bring 459 metric tonnes of cargo with him on his trip - including two Mercedes-Benz s600 limousines and two electric elevators. 
Adji Gunawan of the airfreight company PT Jasa Angkasa Semesta (JAS) told the Antara news agency that his company had been appointed to handle the cargo, which had already arrived in the country. Adji said that his company was employing a total of 572 workers to deal with the Saudi King's luggage. REUTERS 
More than 500 workers have been employed to deal with the Saudi King's luggage. 
Saudi Royals are often known for travelling in grandiose style. Salman booked out the entire Four Seasons hotel in Georgetown when he visited Washington in 2015. The hotel, one of the most luxurious in the area, has 222 rooms.
